casebody.data:
[Crim. No. 1707. First Appellate District, Division One. April 28, 1933.] THE PEOPLE, Respondent, v. J. W. HALL, Appellant.

Leo A. Sullivan and J. L. Royle for Appellant.

U. S. Webb, Attorney-General, and Seibert Sefton for Respondent.

THE COURT.

Application for admission to bail pending appeal. Prom an examination of the record, we are *487satisfied that the trial court did not abuse its discretion in denying defendant’s motion to be admitted to bail pending the hearing on appeal. The application is therefore denied.
